Notes:: (this and above are) initial tests which compared v2 to ordinary; the successful results prompted me to move forward
(this and above show that) non-0.1 and 0.125 values seem to perform worse
0.1 and 0.125 perform similarly against each other given 2 seconds to move, with X usually winning.
Both 0.125 and 0.1 perform similarly against ordinary UCT, though 0.1 performs slightly better, given 2 seconds per move.
Both 0.1 and 0.125 perform similarly against the human (nyfine99), though 0.125 performs slightly better, given 15 seconds per move
0.1 and 0.125 perform similarly against each other given 15 seconds to move.
v3 does not outperform v2, at least not with these parameter values.
